text:
Cookies are stored client side. HubSpot builds the page server side so you don't have access to cookies in the page lifecycle. 

To read cookies you would need to use JavaScript to modify your page

Yeah I gotcha - just trying to leverage them similarly to requests that get handles before the page is rendered like how hsPreview & hsCacheBuster work, I was able to cobble something together and it seems to be rendering now based on if the cookie exists.
Is there a endpoint for evaluating HubL? For some reason I thought there was one but I can't seem to find it
Hey everyone, Is there a way to get the labels of a choice field within a module?
I think you only have access to the value, then you can use supported filters to format the value
what are you trying to do?
Building a way to programmatically test HubL before deployment
yeah i’m not sure how you do that
There's a hack that I've made where you can programmatically update a file using the source code api, then read the page using a preview token
if you add ?hsDebug=true to the url it will give you some debugging stuff in the browser, but i’m sure that isn’t going to help you
That's kind of what I was afraid of. It works until you need special characters. Thanks for confirming though
How are you guys handling importing CSS for custom sections? Just including it in your global CSS, or are you `require_css`’ing it somehow?
I have my own CSS with everything in.

I'm undecided on how it do it. I really want to take a site and test it out in all different ways and speed test it. 

The tools we have to build this out, we can do it in so many ways, but comparing apples to apples is something I wish I had the time for
